documentType: FBI electronic communication and grand jury subpoena compilation
summary: This document is a compilation of FBI electronic communications and grand jury subpoenas issued by the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a subpoena log detailing numerous subpoenas served on telecommunications companies, financial institutions, credit bureaus, and individuals between August and November 2019, seeking records related to Epstein, his associates, and the circumstances surrounding his death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the death investigation. Subpoenas seek all materials relating to him, and he is identified as inmate Reg. No. 76318-054 at MCC.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed all the grand jury subpoenas and accompanying letters requesting confidentiality, directing the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC subpoenaed forthwith on August 14, 2019, to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, her location/activities on August 9-10, 2019, and her cellphone. Her financial records were also subpoenaed from multiple banks and credit bureaus.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC subpoenaed forthwith on August 19, 2019, to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, his location/activities on August 9-10, 2019, and his cellphone. His financial records were also subpoenaed from multiple banks and credit bureaus.

persons.name: Thomas M. Koch
persons.role: Manager, Subpoena Compliance at Sprint Corp.
persons.context: Named as the recipient of a grand jury subpoena and preservation request from Sprint for telephone records.

persons.name: Rick Haas
persons.context: Named as the custodian of records for Experian in a subpoena for credit reports on Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Katrina Shuliac
persons.context: Listed in the subpoena log as a subject/recipient of a subpoena to AT&T served on August 11, 2019.

persons.name: Keith Outlaw
persons.context: Mentioned in the subpoena log regarding a subpoena for MCC call records.

connections.description: Noel was a correctional officer at the MCC where Epstein was held. She was subpoenaed for all materials relating to Epstein and her activities around the time of his death.
Thomas was a correctional officer at the MCC where Epstein was held. He was subpoenaed for all materials relating to Epstein and his activities around the time of Epstein's death.
Both were correctional officers at MCC subpoenaed in the same investigation regarding Epstein's death. Their financial records were requested together from banks and credit bureaus.
As U.S. Attorney, Berman authorized and signed the grand jury subpoenas as part of the official criminal investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The investigation focuses on the circumstances surrounding his death.

events.title: Critical time period for staff activities
events.description: Subpoenas to correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas specifically request materials establishing their location and activities between 7 p.m. on August 9 and 12 p.m. on August 10, 2019, the hours surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: SDNY grand jury subpoena issuance
events.description: The Southern District of New York issues a wide array of grand jury subpoenas to telecommunications companies (AT&T, Apple, Comcast, Sprint, Verizon, T-Mobile), financial institutions (Bank of America, Citibank, JPMC, etc.), credit bureaus (Equifax, Experian, TransUnion), the MCC, and individuals as part of the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Subpoena regarding destruction of MCC records
events.description: A subpoena is issued seeking all materials related to any destruction of records at the Metropolitan Correctional Center after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Hutchinson Whitestone Motel (subpoenaed for surveillance footage and records)
keyFacts: The SDNY issued a massive wave of grand jury subpoenas immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, targeting telecoms, banks, credit agencies, and prison staff.

Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were served with forthwith subpoenas demanding their cellphones and all materials related to Epstein and their whereabouts during the hours surrounding his death.
Subpoenas sought records related to potential destruction of documents at the MCC after Epstein's death, indicating suspicion of evidence tampering.
The investigation sought extensive financial records on Noel and Thomas from nearly every major bank and all three major credit bureaus, suggesting a focus on their financial activities.
The FBI compiled these subpoena logs and communications in December 2019, documenting the expansive investigative steps taken by the SDNY.
